content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Magdeburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Hello Mr. Wang, glad to meet you! The apartment is indeed a beauty, isn't it? Let's get down to business. I'm thinking of renting it out for, say, 1500 Euro per month. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
What is the purpose of the "TERMINATE" keyword in the negotiation dialogue?

In the negotiation dialogue, the "TERMINATE" keyword is used to indicate that the negotiation has been successful and that the parties have reached an agreement on the rental price. When one party says "TERMINATE", it means that they accept the last proposed rental price and that the negotiation is over.

However, if the parties have not reached an agreement on the rental price, the negotiation will also be terminated, but in this case, it will be indicated by one party saying "TERMINATE" followed by a reason why the negotiation was unsuccessful, such as "because we couldn't reach an agreement on the price".

Therefore, the "TERMINATE" keyword serves to signal the end of the negotiation and to indicate whether the negotiation was successful or not.
name: Haoyu Wang from China
